data.name: record_name
data.description: is the name of the record you want to create (ie.: www to create the FQDN www.mydomain.com)

data.name: record_ttl
data.description: is the record TTL in seconds, ranging from 60 to 86400

data.name: record_type
data.description: is the type of the record you want to create (supported types are A, AAAA, CNAME, LOC, MX, NS, RP, SOA, SPF, SRV, TXT)

data.name: record_value
data.description: is the value of the record you want to create. The record value must be coherent with the record_type (ie. MX records must be in the “xx FQDN” format where xx is the MX priority, all IPs must be public, etc)

data.name: zone_name
data.description: is the name of the zone you want to add a record to (ie.: mydomain.com)
This API method adds a new record to a zone. After adding one or more records to a zone the Commit Zone API method must be called in order to make the change(s) active.
data.name: Add zone record
geohost_name
data.description: is the name of the zone you want to commit
This API method commits pending changing for an existing geohost.
data.name: Commit geohost
zone_name
data.description: is the name of the zone you want to commit
This API method commits pending changing for an existing zone. Whenever one record (RRset) is added, modified or deleted the change is saved but not active until this “Commit Zone” method is called.
data.name: Commit zone
contact_email
data.description: is the e-mail address of the zone contact person state is the desired state as either “enable” or “disable” (without quotes)

data.name: state
data.description: is the desired state as either “enable” or “disable” (without quotes)

data.name: zone_name
data.description: is the name of the zone you want to set
This API method creates a new zone. The user must be allowed enough available zones in order to successfully create a new one. Free users can create one zone.
data.name: Create zone
zone_name
data.description: is the name of the zone you want to delete
This API method deletes an existing zone. Deleting a zone completely wipes all records, geohosts, targets and configurations. There is currently no “undo” so this method must be used with care.
data.name: Delete zone
record_id
data.description: is the ID of the record you want to modify. Records IDs can be retrieved using the Get Zone Records method

data.name: zone_name
data.description: is the name of the zone for which you want to modify a record for (ie.: mydomain.com)
This API method deletes an existing zone record. . After deleting one or more records the Commit Zone API method must be called in order to make the change(s) active.
data.name: Delete zone record
geohost_name
data.description: is the name of the geohost you want to get configuration for (ie.: mygeohost.mydomain.com)
This API method fetches a geohost configuration
data.name: Get geohost configuration
zone_name
data.description: is the name of the zone you want to get configuration for (ie.: mydomain.com
This API method fetches a zone configuration
data.name: Get zone configuration
zone_name
data.description: is the name of the zone you want to get records for (ie.: mydomain.com)
This API method fetches all records for a zone
data.name: Get zone records
record_id
data.description: is the ID of the record you want to modify. Records IDs can be retrieved using the Get Zone Records method

data.name: record_name
data.description: is the name of the record you want to create (ie.: www to create the FQDN www.mydomain.com)

data.name: record_ttl
data.description: is the record TTL in seconds, ranging from 60 to 86400

data.name: record_type
data.description: is the type of the record you want to create (supported types are A, AAAA, CNAME, LOC, MX, NS, RP, SOA, SPF, SRV, TXT)

data.name: record_value
data.description: is the value of the record you want to create. The record value must be coherent with the record_type (ie. MX records must be in the “xx FQDN” format where xx is the MX priority, all IPs must be public, etc)

data.name: zone_name
data.description: is the name of the zone for which you want to modify a record for (ie.: mydomain.com)
This API method modifies an existing zone record. . After modifying one or more records the Commit Zone API method must be called in order to make the change(s) active.
data.name: Modify zone record
state
data.description: is the desired state as either “enable” or “disable” (without quotes)

data.name: zone_name
data.description: is the name of the zone you want to set
This API method sets the zone state as either enabled or disabled. An enabled zone handles DNS requests while a disabled zone doesn’t respond to queries.
data.name: Set zone state

description:
GSLB.me is a cloud-based highly reliable DNS and Global Server Load Balancing solution that provides full authoritative DNS services and DNS-based geographical traffic balancing, failover, high availability and geographical routing.

GSLB.me brings you a complete REST-based Application Programming Interface to integrate your own applications and cloud-enabled infrastructures.

The REST API is available for free and allows you to:

- manage dynamic DNS orchestration by creating new DNS records every time a new VPS or Amazon EC2 instance is run
- automatically add, modify and delete DNS records directly from your code without using GSLB.me web GUI
- transparently integrate GSLB.me into your own B2B and B2C services: integrate our services with your own front-end or backend application
- update your dynamic DNS records in real-time

Read the documentation and get started with GSLB.me API for your customized provisioning and orchestration.
name: v1
